episodes.title: William Branham's Message, the Nazis, Jim Jones and even the Kardashians with John Andrew Collins
episodes.description: John Andrew Collins grew up in the royal family of the William Branham Message movement. His grandfather was the senior pastor at Branham's Tabernacle. John began to have doubts when he was 37 and started research that has continued for more than a decade. He is a prolific author who has revealed the intimate connection between some Pentecostalists - including Branham - with the Ku Klux Klan from its re-founding in 1915. He found links between Pentecostal Christianity and the Kardashian family; a Branham complex in Chile that smuggled Nazis into Argentina; the connection between Branham and Jim Jones who was responsible for the Jonestown killings; and even a connection to David 'Moses' Berg founder of the despicable child-molesting Children of God. A fascinating tour through one of the most influential groups in today's politicized religious right.  Spike's note: most of the pictures in this video were taken from John Collins' excellent website - it is truly amazing in the depth of information there, so check it out!!!!   Other Links:  Victim of the Flaming Sword  serpent seed  chart of lineage  Kenya Branham splinter starvation    And a link to a really nifty music video by John Collins - the guy's got some mad talent; check it out!!!

episodes.title: The Brainwashing of My Dad - with Jen Senko
episodes.description: Jen Senko talks about her fascinating documentary and the book of the same title which gives even more detail of the information war waging in the US. Jen's dad Frank was a thoughtful, considerate man who became a raging fanatic when his information sources were restricted to right-wing media - especially Fox "News" and Rush Limbaugh. Jen found that this plague has touched many families in the US. It seems astonishing that a literate, intelligent man who spoke seven languages could have been pulled into this hateful echo chamber. Jen gives us a remarkable perspective on the machinations of the right and the need for us to check our information. episodes.title: Sexually predatory groups: Cult Trip with Anke Richter
episodes.description: Anke Richter is one of the few journalists who has seriously researched authoritarian cults. Her own positive experience with a neo-tantra group helped her to understand the devastations caused by three very different cults: Centrepoint and Gloriavale in Aotearoa, New Zealand, and Agama Yoga in Thailand. Centrepoint was a free-love cult whose leaders were eventually imprisoned for sexual abuse and child sexual abuse. Gloriavale is a contemporary pseudo-Christian cult with bizarre sexual mores. Agama Yoga has been called the 'rape cult' and belongs to the neo-tantra movement - which promotes the notion of bliss or even enlightenment through sex. Anke gives readings from her well-researched and shocking book. A must-read that will become a classic.  Links:  Anke's site: https://www.ankerichter.net/  the Gloriavale Leaver Support Trust: https://www.gloriavaleleavers.org.nz  If you have experienced sexual abuse and need help: US UK   AUS   NZ  If you are feeling suicidal: US   UK   AUS   NZ  Fight Against Conspiracy Theories https://factaotearoa.nz  Portugal sex abuse findings Australian Royal Commission

episodes.title: a warrior's journey in and out of Scientology - with Mark Plummer, part two
episodes.description: Mark continues the story of his amazing journey, including the shocking contents of the "cadet org / cadet estates org establishment eval", one of the most incriminating of all Scientology issues.  This is part two; part one may be found here  links:   Mark's website  cadet org / cadet estates org establishment eval   Lisa McPherson story  Spike's note: Qual = qualifications, where one has to go if you haven't gotten your "training" right. "Word Clearing" is where a Scientologist has to look up the meanings of the words involved in a given document and prove that they understand them. The idea is that the ONLY reason anyone would disagree with an order from Scientology management is that they had a "misunderstood word," that is, they didn't understand a word in the order. In Mark's case, management was essentially telling him that the only reason he didn't want to not spend time with his family was that he had misunderstood some word in one of the relevant Scientology policies, NOT because they were going against their own policies and ignoring the established "family time."

episodes.title: hope for kids in Georgia with Kelvin Pierce
episodes.description: In this heartwarming chat, Kelvin Pierce tells us about his work helping hundreds of children in the small country of Georgia. Kelvin wrote The Sins of My Father about his own terrible childhood as the son of America's leading neo-Nazi - the author of The Turner Diaries. His childhood left him angry and with no self-esteem. He has come to exemplify the thriving survivor. In 1995, he and his wife adopted two babies from Georgia. Ten years later, Kelvin realized that the children were the greatest gift he'd ever received and wanted to give something back. The couple helped to turn around an orphanage in Georgia. Here Kelvin talks about their increasing commitment to children in Georgia through the Divine Child Foundation - not a religious organization, named with the idea that every child is divine. episodes.title: Avatar: Scientology, reworked - with Ariela Sarai
episodes.description: Harry Palmer transformed his Scientology Franchise into Avatar in the 1980s. Despite staff allegations of misconduct, he was able to create a worldwide movement with more members than the International Association of Scientologists. Ariela Sarai graduated from Columbia University in philosophy and religion and then spent six months working with Mother Theresa's outreach program before studying Tibetan Buddhism in the Dalai Lama's community. Returning to the US, she received a Master's in Social Work and was a practicing psychotherapist when therapist friends recruited her into Avatar; she was at the top of the organization by the time she left - after 21 years. Jon discusses the training methods - which borrow extensively from Scientology - the abuse within the group, and her departure and recovery from it. One of the most interesting chats on the channel!  Notes from Ariela:  -The Avatar courses were held in conference rooms in hotels with 200-4000 people from 50 countries attending. When we didn't have a student, we paid an internship fee of $650 plus hotel and airfare to teach the course. I was in the top inner circle, having daily contact with Harry Palmer's wife Avra Honey-Smith. I ran international teams, helping them recruit students and making sure they all had good results using the tools. I was on a course for 14-17 days per month.  -I am now a therapist with a full private practice, and I also work as a leadership coach at a Venture Capital firm. I am dedicated to helping people understand the tactics of manipulation and how to protect themselves and heal from this type of abuse. Although I don't actively seek to get people out of Avatar, I have helped many Avatars who reached out to me and needed help leaving and recovering.  -I am writing a memoir with my partner Mark to share our inner journey of this experience. I am also starting a Newsletter here.  To sign up please go to www.ArielaSarai.com   Additional Links:   Ariela's talk with Chris Shelton  Rachel Bernstein interviews Ariela’s son  Ariela on Rachel Bernstein's podcast:  part one part two   Avatar's "forgiveness option"  Taylor Swift documentary, Americana Girl

episodes.title: growing up in Scientology and beyond - with Aaron Smith-Levin
episodes.description: Through his YouTube channel Growing Up in Scientology, Aaron Smith-Levin has become one of the best-known critics of the cult. His mother joined when he was four and he left school at 12 to study. He was a Sea Org member for a decade before he withdrew and began to speak out. A fascinating interview. Jon demolishes fundamental Hubbard teachings about the eight dynamics and the ARC triangle.   Aaron's channel    Liability formula – when a Scientologist is in any sort of “ethical” trouble (“crimes” can range from adultery to self-pleasure to getting the “wrong” reading on an e-meter), they have to do the “Liability Formula,” one step of which is to “deliver an effective blow to the enemies of Scientology”, meaning they are encouraged to harass any critics in any way they can, regardless of local laws or simple decency.   Tec/Sec ASHO: Technical Secretary - this is the person in charge of all counseling at the Org.  ASHO, or American Saint Hill Organization, is the "Saint Hill-sized" Org in Los Angeles.   RPF = Rehabilitation Project Force:: Members of the Sea Org, Scientology’s fervent core group, have signed a billion-year loyalty contract, are paid next to nothing, live in crowded berthing, work a six ½ -day week and are fed on a poor diet. How can it be made worse to punish them? By being assigned to the Rehabilitation Project Force, where they are stripped of their rank, forced to sleep in “pigs’ berthing”, assigned to the meanest of manual labor, fed on the table scraps of the “regular” Sea Org, made to wear black, not allowed to speak unless spoken to, and made to run rather than walk everywhere. In addition, they are subjected to hours of auditing to find out the “crimes” that they must have committed to have been such a “degraded being.”   TR8 - Training Routine eight involves understanding how to place "Intention" in any object, or, in the case of the routine, an ashtray. To see Jon, Chris Shelton, Christian Szurko, and Steven Hassan break down these TRs, see here. Purification Rundown, aka "Purif" - the sauna and megavitamin-ingestion treatment used by Scientologists to "cleanse" themselves of toxins. Based on outdated pseudoscience and not at all healthy.

episodes.title: Scientology litigation: from Danny Masterson to the IRS
episodes.description: Scientology's former intelligence chief Mike Rinder gives his views on the deadlocked jury and the upcoming civil trial. Mike - who was part of the team that worked on the exemption - offers his opinion on the IRS's crazy decision to grant tax-exemption to the cult. Mike was part of the team that worked on exemption. episodes.title: traditionalism is fake news - with Mark Laxer
episodes.description: Voltaire said that people who believe absurdities will commit atrocities. Traditionalism is the simplistic creation of a golden age to support ideas of tribalism and racial purity. It has taken hold of populist movements and generated a new and ill-informed rightist upsurge. In the US, it is represented by Steve Bannon - who put Trump in the White House and was his first Chief of Staff; in Russia, by Alexander Dugin who preaches the re-unification of the Russian empire; and in Brazil by Olavo de Carvalho - Bolsanaro's guru. These pundits follow the teachings of Mussolini's advisor Julius Evola. They claim spiritual insight, but are ignorant of the subtle and complex ideas of true mysticism, instead grabbing beliefs in human decline - the End Days or Kali Yuga - as if they were prophetic truth, rather than bronze age anxieties. Mark and Jon show how traditions are often inventions to create tribalist separation between people. They offer some solutions to move us towards a pro-social, pro-human democracy that is neither left nor right wing.

episodes.title: Culty Geek - the Gilmore Girls, or, copiously caffeinated culture
episodes.description: Monia has got Spike watching the "Gilmore Girls," and, boy, is there a lot to rant on about! Even in this delightful, wholesome, witty masterpiece there's a couple of tropes on our "culty" list here, principally the human predator posing as the "bad boy who can be fixed by your love (tm)", but also triangulation, emotional manipulation, gaslighting, and even an authoritarian town selectman who feels it's his duty to legislate the main characters' relationships. Spike and Monia pick it all apart, while having a super-caffeinated good time.   Links:   You can read/download our predator poster here: https://jonatacksopeningourminds.files.wordpress.com/2021/09/predator-poster-a2.jpg?w=1448 (left-click on image and select "save image.") Harrison Kowiak's death (his mother's account): https://grownandflown.com/hazing-death-mom-tells-story/   Program notes (by Spike):  The Hays Code (yes, I misspelled it in the video; I also misspelled "caffeinated" on the title card) was a set of industry guidelines set up by US filmmakers of the mid-20th century to self-censor and keep movies in line with the accepted social mores of the time; the section I'm referring to is the proviso that all "wrongdoers" are seen to be punished adequately by the end of the film.  According to the plot synopses I've found, Michel is married to a man in the revival "Year in the Life" episodes. Also, Sookie was originally supposed to be gay but it was considered too risky at the time, at least for the WB. All the Internets points go to whoever can tell me what Sookie's actual first name is; I've looked and looked and can find it nowhere.   According to the Gilmore Girls Wiki, the actress who plays wJess’ dad’s girlfriend plays Luke's season 6 girlfriend/baby-mama Anna Nardini;  Kirk’s girlfriend is played by Rini Bell.

episodes.title: false friendship in cults & post-traumatic growth – with Hoyt Richards
episodes.description: Director and documentarian Hoyt Richards talks with Jon about the growth made possible by traumatic cult experiences and the false friendships found in authoritarian cults.

episodes.title: cults and pro-social behavior - with Jessica Terwiel
episodes.description: Membership of an authoritarian group demands a different set of rules to those of the larger society. Members often adopt anti-social behaviors. Psychologist Jessica Terwiel explores this theme with Jon, sharing her considerable experience of authoritarian groups as a clinical and forensic psychologist.    For more on VTaiwan: https://info.vtaiwan.tw

episodes.title: Scientology: sex magick, Lucifer, and the Antichrist
episodes.description: Hubbard's lifelong commitment to Crowleyite Sex Magick led to him proclaiming himself Lucifer the Antichrist in Scientology's most secret teachings. A deep dive into Hubbard self-hypnotic Affirmations and the real purpose of Scientology.   links:   Jack Parsons' writings: https://sacred-texts.com/oto/lib49.htm Jon's paper on Hubbard and the occult: https://youtu.be/VJbZS9sfRF8 the full list of Hubbard's affirmations: https://gerryarmstrong.ca/the-affirmations-what-was-l-ron-hubbard-thinking/ Hubbard and black magick: https://youtu.be/2ILs6yB-d6A Jon's "Piece of Blue Sky": https://www.amazon.com/Lets-sell-these-people-Piece/dp/1482023032/ Jon's "Cult of Greed: https://www.amazon.com/Scientology-Cult-Greed-Jon-Atack-ebook/dp/B00QVDPM62/

episodes.title: Trailers across time Episode 1 - with Mike Rinder
episodes.description: This is a collection of trailers hand-picked from across 100s of videos to give you, the viewer the most pleasant time watching them, and giving you the opportunity to dive right into our collection of videos. This particular episode collection is about the making and breaking of a Scientologist's belief system, plus some playful, more personal clips from our own creators. If this goes well we will be including a whole range of material, including trailers to help you navigate individual playlists, to make you an expert at challenging all sorts of absurd belief systems. Remembering not beliefs (necessarily), but the methods which seek to move against the realisation (through understanding) of those beliefs, through recruitment techniques which are manipulative, is hurtful, and immoral. Have fun! First months on Hubbard’s flagship Apollo 4 mins 10 secs (in podcast) Mike Rinder on meeting Commodore Hubbard 8 mins 32 secs Leaving TM and Scientology behind 15 mins 14 secs The self and others 18 mins 41 secs Unhelpful help 21 mins 2 secs Just wake up 15 minutes earlier 21 mins 9 secs Information overload 24 mins 55 secs Love in the time of Corona 28 mins 44 secs Drug prohibition – the history 32 mins 41 secs

episodes.title: Jon and Karen uncover some Scientology lies
episodes.description: Jon and Karen talk about how language is used to control thought –  particularly in Scientology and especially in its paramilitary branch,  the Sea Org. They reminisce about dear friends lost to the web of this  controlling group, and their hopes for the future.   links:  to a .pdf of the full appendix to Orwell's 1984:  https://kickapooclark.weebly.com/uploads/5/0/8/5/5085586/the_principles_of_newspeak_orwell.pdf   the shrinking world of L Ron Hubbard: https://youtu.be/L_w-YWwC1lI   for Hubbard's full letter to the Vets' Administration:  https://www.spaink.net/cos/LRH-bio/psychbeg.htm   to read Jon's paper "Scientology: Religion or Intelligence Agency" :  http://home.snafu.de/tilman/j/berlin.html?fbclid=IwAR3G8FA_m_jpw1sqwJLRTPtqlT8vTONCYInPmOlZ5yDPQVsNQeY8aNRAMto   to see the excellent work done by the Aftermath Foundation:  http://theaftermathfoundation.org

episodes.title: Scientology arrives in Clearwater - part 3 of Mike Rinder’s Scientology story
episodes.description: Mike Rinder continues his account of his life in Scientology, focusing  this week on the first years ashore in Florida, when Scientology began  buying property in Clearwater, posing as the fictious “Southern Land  Development Corporation”. In between some fascinating tangents and  comparisons to Clearwater’s more current experiences with Scientology,  Mike and Jon discuss the organization’s legal battles of that era,  particularly with Clearwater mayor Gabe Cazares and other early critics.  As always, it’s a wild ride, and an amazing, must-listen conversation.   the Clearwater hearings: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLB8A8C6C0BFB607D1   the Truth Rundown articles: https://www.tampabay.com/special-reports/2019/10/17/scientology-the-truth-rundown/   the Truth Rundown book: https://www.amazon.com/Truth-Rundown-violence-intimidation-Scientology-ebook/dp/B013UWYHAI   To learn about the death of Kyle Brnnan: kyle page: http://www.kylebrennan.com   To learn about the death of Lisa McPherson: lisa page: http://lisamcpherson.org

episodes.title: Jamie DeWolf: behind the curtain
episodes.description: Jamie DeWolf, great-grandson of Ron Hubbard, talks with Jon about his  infamous ancestor, and about his mission to speak out against the  Scientology “dragon” his infamous ancestor brought into the world.   if you would like to rent or buy the videos from the "Getting Clear"  conference, they are available here:  https://vimeo.com/ondemand/gettingclear two of the sessions are available free here:  https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOprfY0DnRsZ3rZ1a4TomFI8R_8uw_7Uu   The Shrinking World of L. Ron Hubbard: https://youtu.be/L_w-YWwC1lI  Scientology: A Faith for Sale: https://youtu.be/aFpgWjtcwYg   to stream the Nature of Existence: http://thenatureofexistence.com   for more of Jamie's work, see his website: https://www.jamiedewolf.com see Jamie in "Salvation Summer Camp": https://youtu.be/e_pdu9N1yeY

episodes.title: suggestibility, susceptibility & Derren Brown – with Hoyt Richards
episodes.description: Our friend Hoyt Richards joins Jon for a discussion about Derren Brown’s work and how it shows our suggestibility and susceptibility to fraud of  all kinds.   the Cottingley Fairies: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cottingley_Fairies   Derren Brown and Simon Pegg: https://youtu.be/rr05Dchmlww

episodes.title: Karen De La Carriere speaks out against Scientology
episodes.description: Karen De La Carriere is one of a handful of people who achieved the  pinnacle of Scientology training, the Class XII auditor course. In this  wide-ranging discussion, she talks about conditions aboard Hubbard’s  flagship, about the negligence that led to her son’s death, and her  attitude to Scientology now after her forty-year membership.   Links: Karen's channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/SurvivingScientology  Jeffrey Augustine's Scientology Money Project: https://scientologymoneyproject.com   L Rundowns: https://www.xenu.net/archive/L-Rundowns/ Aberree: https://www.aberree.com   Shrinking world: https://youtu.be/L_w-YWwC1lI   The memorial Service for Alexander Jentzsch: https://youtu.be/msHDW2g7GM0

episodes.title: polarization vs. cooperation - with Joe Szimhart
episodes.description: concepts of "left" and "right" have become meaningless, thought-stopping  labels; Joe Szimhart joins Jon to deconstruct what is really meant by  these terms - and how it is much better to cooperate and find common  ground than to polarize into separate, ever-battling camps.

episodes.title: cult recruitment and the autistic spectrum - with Richard Turner
episodes.description: Counsellor Richard Turner talks with Jon about how cults take advantage of people who are, like him, on the autistic spectrum.  For more on Bhutan's Gross National Happiness: https://www.bhutan.travel/page/gross-national-happiness  Richard's Website: www.tothinkagain.co.uk Richard's Linked in profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/richard-j-turner/ Article Richard wrote about cults and autism: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/autism-cults-richard-james-turner/

episodes.title: Mike Rinder on Scientology: deception, delusion, and cognitive dissonance
episodes.description: Mike and Jon explore the striking difference between Hubbard’s public  pose as a benefactor and the reality of his rage, illness, sadism and  paranoia.  links to the Hubbard death announcement event: full event: https://youtu.be/rR6R80W2J8Y Miscavige’s announcement: https://youtu.be/dgDa22Fx_V4

episodes.title: QAnon, fervor, and being certain with Yuval Laor, PhD
episodes.description: what is the difference between casual and fervent belief? how does the feeling of certainty drive a believer’s sense of reality? Yuval Laor, PhD, joins Jon for a discussion on these and other matters.

episodes.title: Mike Rinder's first months on Hubbard's flagship Apollo
episodes.description: An astonishing series of revelations about Scientology's abuse of its members. Mike Rinder describes his arrival on Scientology's flagship the  Apollo at the tender age of 18. Sent from Australia for management training, after handing over his passport, he found he'd been traded in a  typical case of Scientology's human trafficking. Conditions for the "elite" Sea Org under Hubbard's direct control were deplorable. As Mike says, the former cattle hold which had become the men's dorm was like "the black hole of Calcutta" and the food was "garbage". Mike was tasked with "baby-watching" the first victim of the Introspection Rundown (on which Lisa McPherson later died), which Hubbard claimed would cure insanity. Mike was also the only Scientologist left on the island of  Madeira after the notorious "rock festival", where locals hurled bricks  and cobblestones at the Apollo, and was lucky to escape with his life. links: ex-Scientology kids: http://exscientologykids.com the Aftermath Foundation: http://theaftermathfoundation.org

episodes.title: apologies, self-esteem, and other esteem with Jessica Terwiel
episodes.description: often apologies are not really apologies. Psychologist Jessica Terwiel  also talks with Jon about the importance of self-esteem and the need for  “other-esteem”.

episodes.title: art, virtuosity, and the stuff in the middle - with Rio Harada-Parr
episodes.description: Rio joins Jon to chat about virtuosity, art, ego and talent. As usual, they make a whistle-stop tour of art and music history.  See Jon's paintings, poetry, and thoughts on music, art, literature and life at http://jonatack.com

episodes.title: elfcam: Big Santa is watching you!
episodes.description: Light-hearted Christmas fun or cold-blooded manipulation? In the age of  Big Brother, is it sensible to trick our children into believing they’re  constantly under surveillance? Maybe deception really shouldn't be part  of the spirit of Christmas.

episodes.title: Ron Hubbard: Black Magic, Dianetics and the Creation of Scientology
episodes.description: Jon’s opening talks from the legendary 2015 Getting Clear conference.  Jon gives an overview of Hubbard’s own history – including his  involvement with ritual Sex Magick – and the creation of Dianetics  through the early years of Scientology. Including an interview by  Stephen Jones with Hubbard biographer Russell Miller.  Jon gives some surprising answers to questions about the founder of  Scientology, including how many of the Dianetics and Scientology books  did Hubbard actually write? Did Hubbard steal the Dianetic technique  from psychiatrists? Why did Hubbard sell the rights to Dianetics to Don  Purcell for one dollar? Why did Hubbard register the Church of  Scientology secretly, and why did he register the Church of American  Science (the “mother church”) and the Church of Spiritual Engineering?  Are the Scientology upper levels an aspect of ritual magic?  You can rent the complete set of lectures from this important conference  on vimeo, here: https://vimeo.com/ondemand/gettingclear

episodes.title: do we make a difference?
episodes.description: Jon talks with his good friend Chris Shelton about whether our work  makes a difference. As ever, we touch on many topics, including recovery  from authoritarian groups and relationships, and the need to prepare  the next generation so that they will not be so easily exploited by  gurus, spin-doctors and other malignant narcissists. links:    The Randy Newman song that mentions Hitler and Stalin is A Few Words in  Defense of Our Country - here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0EAwSpTcM4   Bob Newhart – Stop It!:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ow0lr63y4Mw&t=138s   Empathy Quotient test:  https://psychology-tools.com/test/empathy-quotient    Jon’s Never Believe a Hypnotist cites tens of Ron Hubbard’s often conflicting statements about hypnosis. A must-read for anyone who has  been involved in Scientology. Read it free, here:  http://lermanet.org/exit/parsons.html   Arnie Lerma’s Ten Steps Out of Scientology is here:  https://lermanet.org/cos/8steps.html  Jon does not entirely agree with it (especially the bit about realizing  you are an ‘ex-Nazi’), but it is a model that can be varied according to  the experience of the reader. Chris and Jon will talk in more detail  about the stages of recovery very soon.

episodes.title: Captain Bill, the craziest Scientologist?
episodes.description: Jon reminisces with Sam about the craziest Scientologist he ever knew:  legendary Captain Bill Robertson, founder and architect of “Ron’s Org”  and the independent Scientology Freezone. Jon reads extracts from  Captain Bill’s Sector Operations Bulletins – which Bill claimed to have  received telepathically from Ron Hubbard – aboard the “Mothership” – In  1982.    Crown Hotel Meeting, Oct 18, 1983 https://youtu.be/tvfioivtY6c  Sector 9 book: http://galac-patra.org/sector9.html   For Scientology membership numbers: https://medium.com/how-many-scientologists-are-there-really)    Peter Forde's analysis of OT III: https://www.spaink.net/cos/essays/forde_volcanos.html

episodes.title: New Kadampa Tradition - a talk with Michelle Haslam
episodes.description: jon is joined by special guest Dr. Michelle Haslam; they discuss her  time in the authoritarian group known as "new kadampa tradition", her  background in psychology, and how and why people are drawn into  destructive groups.  links discussed in the video: the research of Miriam Anders on the cultic misuse of Buddhist  teachings: https://www.mdpi.com/2077-1444/10/11/622/htm   The Pema Chödrön Foundation: https://pemachodronfoundation.org  the findings of the Australian Royal Commission on Institutional  Responses to Child Sexual Abuse:  https://www.childabuseroyalcommission.gov.au   Michelle's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDz-Wk0ykecFBgB7Pg31cVQ/videos   and for help getting out of/surviving the NKT and other similar groups,  Michelle's website is here: https://newkadampatraditionreport.org   jon's paper, the Total Freedom Trap:  https://www.cs.cmu.edu/~dst/Fishman/atack-freedom-trap.html   Sir Ken Robinson's work: http://sirkenrobinson.com

episodes.title: parental alienation and prevention with Nick Child
episodes.description: What happens when after separating, one parent turns the children  against the other? Retired psychiatrist Nick Child talks to Jon about  the dire failure of the court system, and how to focus on the needs of  the children.   links:   Nick’s blog: https://thealienationexperience.org.uk  Blink, Think, Choice Voice: https://youtu.be/RdKPIK71SP8 (and Spike’s song based on it): https://youtu.be/La2NnQVwJXE  Socrates for six-year-olds (poor quality): https://youtu.be/vyD0l9En6Io  the Brainwashing of my Dad: https://www.thebrainwashingofmydad.com/  Institute for propaganda analysis: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Institute_for_Propaganda_Analysis

episodes.title: truth and certainty with Mike Rinder
episodes.description: Mike Rinder joins Jon again to answer some viewer questions and address  L. Ron Hubbard's problematic relationship to the truth. They also  discuss how the feeling of certainty keeps the members of many  destructive authoritarian groups from asking questions, considering that  the leader might be wrong, or even leaving the group.   links:  to Jon's paper "the possible origins for Dianetics and Scientology":  http://home.snafu.de/tilman/j/origins6.html?fbclid=IwAR3-V34IOIp8GcbWyOk_jdRtuMEV2S4NiA_m-igR0O17DNAvn7A79uK8IdQ#F63   and the accompanying video: https://youtu.be/VGQXQaiLa2A

episodes.title: possible origins of Dianetics and Scientology, part one
episodes.description: Does Scientology have origins in Sex Magick and Psychoanalysis? Is Ron  Hubbard’s claim to have been the only “source” of Dianetics and  Scientology true? Jon examines Hubbard’s many borrowings from other  authors and shows that Hubbard was aware of many of these sources.   This is the third in a series of recordings of Jon's papers on  Scientology, all of which are available to read free here:  https://www.facebook.com/notes/jon-atack/jons-writings-books-speeches/284316635347772/   To see the other two recordings of Jon reading his papers, see our  playlist here:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOprfY0DnRsb0GBFQzrqmpMmNLRL6vmYi   To see Jon's talk on the history of Hubbard and the origins of  Scientology: https://youtu.be/2ILs6yB-d6A   Buy your copy of Jon's Tao Te Ching here:  https://www.amazon.com/Tao-Te-Ching-Lao-Tzu-ebook/dp/B072JL13DR/   And Let's Sell These People a Piece of Blue Sky here:  https://www.amazon.com/Lets-sell-these-people-Piece-ebook/dp/B00BF385HG/  (now FREE with Kindle Unlimited!)   For Jeff Jacobsen's work on Hubbard:  http://www.xenu.net/archive/lrhbare/ his other writings: http://jeffjacobsen.org/writings.htm and his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/cultxpt  please also see  Caroline Letkeman’s excellent work on the origins of  Scientology: http://www.carolineletkeman.org/propaganda/papers.html

episodes.title: possible origins of Dianetics and Scientology, part two
episodes.description: the second part of Jon's paper about Ron Hubbard's plagiarism. Hubbard  was not the 'sole source' of Dianetics and Scientology, nor did all of  the 'major' ideas come from him. With a comparison of Tibetan ideas  popularized by Alexandra David-Neel in the 1930s to some of the  fundamental ideas of Scientology.  With many thanks to Mark Owen Plummer, for help in finding the right  covers to the correct editions.   This is the second of two parts; here is part one:  https://youtu.be/VGQXQaiLa2A   This is the fourth in a series of recordings of Jon's papers on  Scientology, all of which are available to read free here:  https://www.facebook.com/notes/jon-atack/jons-writings-books-speeches/284316635347772/   To see the previous videos of Jon reading his papers, see our playlist  here:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOprfY0DnRsb0GBFQzrqmpMmNLRL6vmYi   To see Jon's talk on the history of Hubbard and the origins of  Scientology: https://youtu.be/2ILs6yB-d6A

episodes.title: manipulation by gaslighting - a talk with Spike Robinson
episodes.description: gaslighting is the “royal road” to exerting control – but can you spot  it? Spike joins Jon to talk about gaslighting and the major techniques  predators use to confuse and paralyze people into compliance.   links:  the Levenson empathy index: https://openpsychometrics.org/tests/LSRP.php     Australian Royal Commission final report:  https://www.childabuseroyalcommission.gov.au/final-report   Gaslighting:  the play:  https://www.amazon.com/Gaslight-Frenchs-Acting-Patrick-Hamilton/dp/0573115796/     rent the 1940 movie:  https://www.amazon.com/Gaslight-Anton-Walbrook/dp/B002R1Q1ZS/    or watch free on YouTube:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UYmtzaHwCKo&t=8s    the DVD of the 1944 movie:  https://www.amazon.com/Gaslight-Charles-Boyer/dp/B07N4CL3HD/   and take our fun gaslighting quiz here: shorturl.at/glnN2

episodes.title: how Scientology harassment works - with Mike Rinder
episodes.description: Mike Rinder was head of Scientology’s sophisticated harassment  department for 20 years. In this stunning interview he describes the  fanatical determination to utterly ruin anyone who questions Hubbard's  work as a 'Supppressive Person', an 'enemy' of humanity. That included  Jon, when they last spoke in the mid-90s. Mike shows the secret Hubbard  documents that direct the harassment of 'Suppressives' and describes in  chilling detail the activities of the Office of Special Affairs which is  now trying to silence him with a typical smear campaign. In the 80s and  90s there were only a handful of persistent critics, but now thousands  are speaking out, so Scientology no longer has the resources to harass  any but its most vocal critics. These include Mike Rinder who has become  Scientology's most dangerous former insider.    We urge you to join the #IGotOut campaign!    for Chris Owens' research and papers on Scientology: http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~dst/Cowen/  for Jon's paper, "Scientology: religion or intelligence agency?": http://home.snafu.de/tilman/j/berlin.html?fbclid=IwAR3G8FA_m_jpw1sqwJLRTPtqlT8vTONCYInPmOlZ5yDPQVsNQeY8aNRAMto   Mike Rinder's blogpost on Scientology's harassment procedures: https://www.mikerindersblog.org/dealing-with-critics-of-scientology-the-l-ron-hubbard-playbook/   for the documentary, "the Shrinking World of L. Ron Hubbard": https://youtu.be/L_w-YWwC1lI   for all the current news on Scientology, check out Tony Ortega's Underground Bunker: https://tonyortega.org   for Chris Shelton's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF326xyA0QHI7Z5xAwKQDJg

episodes.title: the Kazan seminar on cults with Professor Alexander Dvorikin
episodes.description: Jon joins Professor Alexander Dvorkin for the Kazan seminar in Kazan, in  the republic of Tatarstan, Russia, speaking remotely to an audience of  psychologists and educators about cults and how to deal with them.   links:  How Scientology Harassment works with Mike Rinder: https://youtu.be/M6KxZ6lnvIU   predator list: https://www.facebook.com/AuthorJonAtack/posts/1076831346096293    predator video: https://youtu.be/fHgbFLN3Nvs   Ira Chaleff's "Blink, Think, Choice, Voice": https://youtu.be/RdKPIK71SP8  (and Spike's song based on his handbook): https://youtu.be/La2NnQVwJXE   Yuval's presentation on fervor (part one): https://youtu.be/JF7ImlGUgCQ

episodes.title: moving beyond the guru - with Joe Kelly
episodes.description: Joe Kelly spent nine years in Transcendental Meditation and then five  more with a rival swami, who convinced his former TM followers to sue  for refunds from that group. This led to Joe meeting Margaret Singer,  who helped to begin to rethink his involvement. For many years, Joe has  worked helping members of authoritarian groups to rethink their  involvement.   note: the former Cult Awareness Network was shut down as a result of a  Scientology lawsuit, and then sold to that group as part of the  resulting settlement. Today those who contact CAN via its website or  phone number are connected to a Scientology front group. For more  information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Cult_Awareness_Network    links:  to the documentary ‘Captive Minds’: https://youtu.be/9UEfsSauTf4 the full story of the song ‘Sexy Sadie’: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexy_Sadie

episodes.title: brainwashing
episodes.description: jon and sam talk about the concept of brainwashing, as it is understood -  and misunderstood - by academics and governments. they consider the  ancient history of the term, and the modern applications being used to  deny whole populations their basic human rights worldwide.

episodes.title: human predators
episodes.description: jon and sam atack discuss what we mean by the term "human predator", and  how to spot and avoid those people who hurt others for their own gain  or even amusement.  for more information on human predators, including the complete list of  traits, check out jon's article here:  https://www.openmindsfoundation.org/faces_of_undue_influence/what-is-manipulation/human-predator/

episodes.title: recruitment and seduction
episodes.description: jon and sam atack discuss how people get seduced or recruited into high-control groups or relationships.

episodes.title: Types of predator
episodes.description: jon and sam discuss the types of predatory people, how people become  predatory, and what they would like to see done to guard the world from  those who manipulate and hurt others for their own gain or amusement.   for more information on human predators, including the complete list of  traits, check out jon's article here:  https://www.openmindsfoundation.org/faces_of_undue_influence/what-is-manipulation/human-predator/ follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/atack_jon  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AuthorJonAtack and on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jon_atack Or watch our YouTubes : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCI4tcSMV2kEh3BooY_XFSYQ
